title: Ticket #2382: command.cpp accept_request_claim uses uninitialized variable
description:
accept_request_claim in /src/condor_startd.V6/command.cpp uses tmp uninitialized at or around line 1450. This appears to be the result of a bad change made in 6d7422387233fdeddfb0cadf95d672c342b0ac2e as part of the IPv6 work.

  1. DONE Develop patch
  2. DONE It's an old (December 2010) change; did we ship a stable with the bug? - 7.7.0, but no earlier. Stable is fine.
  3. DONE Determine impact of bug for eventual Changelog entry - Minimal. Erroneous warning when the startd has D_FULLDEBUG enabled. Despite the warning, the hostname does end up assigned. If no hostname could be found at all, the startd might incorrectly advertise a null ClientMachine.
  4. DONE Commit
  5. DONE Document
remarks:
2011-Aug-15 12:51:00 by tannenba:
Would be nice for the ticket to describe what (if any) impact this has on the user. Thanks.

2011-Aug-16 11:31:42 by matt:
What are the Broken Version / Fixed Version?
